column4: Hi, I just tried to upgrade ubuntu though the package manager, and it seems to have failed... now i'm stuck in a dependency loop and cannot upgrade anything
what do I do?
did you upgrade to a new distro?  from what to what?
I tried to upgrade from 10.4 to 10.10
the upgrade aborted
sorry, i'm on a live usb testing out some stuff.  did someone answer your question?
no

well, i'm not really sure what the error is, but i just realized myself that trying out an upgrade version of ubuntu on a live usb first is a great idea before upgrading...if you can afford a live usb that is.  but let me check launchpad for you.  can you provide more details?
I have no other details.. what is it that you're looking for? Also, I'm not interested in wiping my entire partition just to update packages.. that's rediculous
no, not wiping out partitions.  just trying the distro out from a live usb to see how it works on your hardware.  i am checking launchpad to see if anyone else has had the same problem
then i do not understand your question.  i thought you upgraded from jaunty to maverick (10.04 to 10.10) and you were having a problem with it "looping"
I "attempted" to upgrade from 10.4 to 10.10, but the upgrade aborted (packaage manager)
oh, i see.  i thought the upgrade was botched and you couldn't boot.
did you get a specific error back from synaptic?
my fear is that why I reboot, I will not boot properly and will have to go into recovery mode.. that being said, trying to update or backtrack would be unlikely since I'm stuck in a dependency loop
i am searching here:  https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/ for "upgrade to maverick failed"
.... okay
do you have any idea why i'd be stuck in a dependency loop?
no i don't.  i would have to google your problem.  do some research to see what i can find.
i don't think ignoring dependencies is a good idea.
okay, so how do I go about breaking this dependency loop? Ignoring the dependency and installing the dependents one by one seems to make a whole lot of sense
in fact, it's the only thing I can think of atm though would fix the problem
